metadata.dc:author: Guillén Marco, A
Níguez, J C
García-Marcos, L
Guillén Pérez, J J
metadata.dc:description: Studies on air pollution (SO2) and their influence on respiratory diseases in children conducted in Cartagena are reviewed and compared with those from other spanish cities. In Cartagena we find a weak relation between SO2 levels and number of children admitted to hospital for asthma attack. Indoor pollution is stressed, specially smoking of mother.
metadata.dc:title: Polución atmosférica y enfermedad respiratoria en niños. Experiencia de Cartagena.
[Air pollution and respiratory disease in children. Experience in Cartagena].
